meanings.definition: A consequence of an action or event, especially when complex or unwelcome.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected ramification of missing the bus was being late for school.
meanings.sent2: The company faced serious ramification after the data breach.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up at the party had a funny ramification - everyone wore the wrong hats.
meanings.sent4: The decision to cut down the old tree had far-reaching ramification on the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The ramification of not studying for the test was failing it.

meanings.definition: The act of branching out or dividing into separate parts or sections.
meanings.sent1: The ramification of the river into smaller streams created a beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent2: The tree's ramification reached out in all directions, providing shade to many.
meanings.sent3: The ramification of the family tree was so vast that they needed a big chart to show it all.
meanings.sent4: The ramification of the road network connected the town to neighboring cities.
meanings.sent5: The ramification of the power grid ensured electricity reached every home.
